entry.title: Re: Issue with Facebook login via mobile browser
entry.content:
There is a known issue with Facebook login in the popup.  It happens because Facebook has started adding new security headers that block pop-ups from being communicated from cross-origin parent windows, which eventually prevents popups from closing and notify parent windows that a session was created.

Note:  These headers are not present all the time or not on all Facebook URLs, so the issue does not always reproduce.

Solution:

Make sure to implement social login with the authFlow: "redirect" parameter that can be invoked through either:

  • the global WebSDK Configuration,
  • the accounts.showScreenSet JS WebSDK method,
  • or the accounts.socialLogin JS Web SDK method

depending on what aligns best with your current implementation.

The default flow - authFlow: "popup" - does not work well in mobile browser environments due to different handling of cookies, iFrames, etc. that our Web SDK depends on. CNAME and Custom API Domain setup is required when using authFlow: "redirect".

Documentation:

3422488 - Facebook social login from a browser on mobile devices does not work - SAP for Me

3328279 - Error during first login with Facebook on mobile devices (Android and iOS) - SAP for Me

accounts.socialLogin JS | SAP Help Portal

entry.title: EWM: How to determine HU/Packing status before Set Ready for Shipment to avoid printing duplicate
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

We are working on an SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud EWM scenario with Goods Issue (GI) label printing and are facing a challenge related to duplicate label generation.

Current Process

  • GI labels are printed during the packing process in EWM, triggered by the Warehouse Task Confirmed event.
  • During packing:
    • An internal Warehouse Task (WT) is created
    • GI label is printed based on the WT number
    • A Handling Unit (HU) is created as part of the packing process

      New Requirement

      • Print the GI label at the Set Ready for Shipment stage using the Outbound Delivery Change event.
      • This should happen only for deliveries that are not packed into an HU.

        Issue

        • When the delivery is set to Ready for Shipment, GI labels are also getting printed for deliveries that are already packed in HU, resulting in duplicate label printing.

          Analysis Done

          • We explored checking the packing status (HU existence) using:
          • I_OutboundDelivery 
          • I_OutboundDeliveryItem 
          • However, since packing and label printing are executed within EWM, these CDS views are not updated in real time during the packing process.
          • We also could not find any EWM-specific CDS views that reliably expose real-time packing or HU status.

            Question
            Is there a recommended or alternative approach in EWM to reliably determine whether:

            • Packing has already been completed, or
            • An HU already exists for the delivery
              before triggering GI label printing at the Set Ready for Shipment stage, so that duplicate printing can be avoided?

              Any guidance on best practices, EWM events, APIs, CDS views, or extensibility options would be highly appreciated.

              Thanks in advance for your support

              •

entry.title: Re: Differences between SAP ECC and S/4 HANA in HCM
entry.content:
SAP HCM Integration with SuccessFactors: Details, Licensing & Benefits

Integration Overview

SAP HCM integration with SuccessFactors represents a strategic transition from on-premise HR systems to cloud-based Human Experience Management (HXM). This integration enables organizations to maintain their existing SAP HCM infrastructure while leveraging SuccessFactors' advanced cloud capabilities for enhanced employee experiences and modern HR processes.

The integration supports multiple deployment scenarios including side-by-side HCM, core hybrid HCM, and full migration approaches, allowing organizations to choose the path that best fits their business requirements and timeline .

Integration Details

Technical Integration Components

The integration utilizes middleware solutions, particularly SAP Cloud Integration, to facilitate seamless data exchange between SAP HCM and SuccessFactors modules. Key integration scenarios include:

  • Employee Data Integration: Bidirectional synchronization of employee master data between systems
  • Compensation Data Transfer: Extract compensation data from SAP S/4HANA and transfer to SuccessFactors for planning, then return planned data for payroll processing
  • Recruiting Data Integration: Seamless flow of candidate and hiring data between recruiting and core HR systems
  • Variable Pay Data: Integration of variable compensation components across systems
Data Migration & Mapping
  1. Employee Master Data Transfer: Core employee information, personal data, and employment relationships
  2. Organizational Structure Mapping: Cost centers, organizational units, and reporting hierarchies,
  3. Payroll and Compensation Data: Salary structures, benefits, and compensation planning data
  4. Time and Attendance Records: Working time data, absences, and time sheet information.
System Architecture Post-Integration

The integrated architecture maintains SAP HCM as the system of record for certain processes while leveraging SuccessFactors for talent management, performance, and employee experience functions. This hybrid approach ensures data consistency while enabling modern HR capabilities.

Licensing Structure

SuccessFactors Module Licensing
Module License Type Features Included
Employee CentralPer employee/monthCore HR data management, organizational structure
Performance & GoalsPer employee/monthPerformance evaluations, goal setting, talent management
Learning ManagementPer employee/monthTraining programs, development planning, compliance tracking
Recruiting ManagementPer employee/monthTalent acquisition, candidate management, recruiting marketing
Compensation ManagementPer employee/monthCompensation planning, pay equity analysis
OnboardingPer employee/monthNew hire processes, integration workflows
Additional Licensing Considerations

Organizations considering integration should note that maintaining both SAP HCM and SuccessFactors could require multiple licenses including "BizX, WFA, Fiori, HCM, ESS/MSS, Payroll, BI/BO, HANA, EFM" depending on desired functionality. For GROW with SAP customers, a "GROW with SAP, core HR add-on" provides integrated SuccessFactors capabilities with additional licensing costs.

Cost Factors
  • Company size and employee count directly impact subscription costs
  • Geographic deployment affects pricing due to regional compliance requirements
  • Integration complexity and customization needs influence implementation costs
  • SAP Cloud Platform Integration is included with People Central Hub subscriptions

Benefits of HCM Implementation

Operational Benefits
  1. Streamlined HR Processes: Unified platform for all HR functions from recruiting to retirement
  2. Automated Workflow Management: Cross-system workflows that harmonize processes across hybrid landscapes
  3. Reduced Manual Data Entry: Automated data synchronization between systems
  4. Improved Compliance Tracking: Built-in compliance features for global regulations including GDPR
Strategic Benefits
  • Enhanced Employee Experience: Modern, intuitive interfaces with mobile accessibility
  • Better Talent Management: Integrated performance, learning, and development capabilities
  • Data-Driven Decision Making: Advanced analytics and reporting across all HR functions
  • Scalability for Business Growth: Cloud-based architecture supports organizational expansion
Financial Benefits
  • Cost Reduction: Lower total cost of ownership through cloud delivery model
  • Efficiency Gains: Streamlined processes reduce administrative overhead
  • ROI Realization: Improved productivity and reduced manual processes deliver measurable returns
Technology Benefits
  • Cloud-Based Accessibility: Secure, scalable access from anywhere
  • Mobile Workforce Enablement: Native mobile applications for HR tasks
  • Integration Capabilities: Seamless connection with other SAP and third-party systems
  • Continuous Innovation: Regular updates and new features delivered quarterly

Implementation Considerations

Organizations should plan for comprehensive change management, including user training and adoption strategies. The integration timeline varies based on complexity, but the modular approach allows for phased implementation. Risk mitigation includes thorough testing of data synchronization and maintaining backup systems during transition periods.

Success Metrics

Key performance indicators include user adoption rates, process efficiency improvements, data accuracy metrics, and cost savings realization. Organizations typically measure success through reduced time-to-hire, improved employee satisfaction scores, and decreased HR administrative costs.

Regards,

Bharanidharan S P M

entry.title: Which types of quotations and number of records are supported by the "Import Sales Quotations" app
entry.content:
Hello SAP Experts

Our business requirement is that we need to export a huge number of Sales Quotations in the "Import Sales Quotations" app however, we are in doubt about:

  1. Which type of quotation is supported in the application?
  2. How many quotations can I import at the same time?

 

Thank you for your help


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Which types of quotations and number of records are s...
entry.content:
Dear SAP Community

The app "Import Sales Quotations" app supports quotations that belong to the type B (Quotation):

Example Sales Document Type - QT

 

Pay attention to the current constraints of the application:

  • The app supports a limited number of sales quotation types:

    • Quotation types must belong to document category B (Quotation).

    • Sales quotations do not have to be created with reference to a preceding document.
       Note

      Key users can query whether a reference document is mandatory for quotation creation by checking the configuration of a sales quotation type. To do so, open the Configure Sales Document Types configuration activity in your configuration environment.

  • This app does not support one-time customers or configurable products (that is, configurable materials).

SAP Recommendation is to import 1000 records per import, the data limits are defined in SAP backend and are shared across all SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition users, to ensure network stability and performance to everyone, those values are not editable.
More detailed information can be checked in the official SAP Help Portal app documentation:
  • Import Sales Quotations

Kind regards

entry.title: Re: Count on fiori Iview
entry.content:
@rajeshkumarp Service URL Parameter Configuration

For displaying workitem count on your My Inbox Fiori iView tile in SAP Portal, you need to configure the correct Service URL parameter. Based on your specific scenario, use one of the following Service URL formats:

Standard My Inbox Count Service URL

/sap/opu/odata/IWPGW/TASKPROCESSING;v=2;mo/TaskCollection/$count/?$filter=Status eq 'READY' or Status eq 'RESERVED' or Status eq 'IN_PROGRESS' or Status eq 'EXECUTED'

Alternative Service URL Format

If the above doesn't work, try:

/sap/opu/odata/IWPGW/TASKPROCESSING;v=2;mo/ItemcountCollection/$count

The key difference is using ItemcountCollection/$count instead of TaskCollection/$count.

Unit Label Configuration

For the Unit Label parameter, you should configure:

  • Unit Label Value: Enter a descriptive label such as:
    • Items - for general workitem count
    • Tasks - for task-specific count
    • Workitems - for workflow items
    • Leave blank if you prefer no unit label display

The unit label appears below the count number on the tile to provide context for users.

Troubleshooting Steps

Step 1: Verify Service URL Format

  1. Ensure the Service URL includes the complete path with /$count parameter
  2. Check that the filter conditions match your workitem statuses
  3. Test the URL directly in browser to verify it returns a numeric count

Step 2: Check Portal Configuration

  1. Access your Portal iView configuration
  2. Navigate to the tile properties section
  3. Verify the Service URL field contains the complete OData endpoint
  4. Ensure no truncation occurs in the URL field

Step 3: Validate OData Service Response

The service should return a simple numeric count. Test the URL:

https:///sap/opu/odata/IWPGW/TASKPROCESSING;v=2;mo/TaskCollection/$count/?$filter=Status eq 'READY' or Status eq 'RESERVED' or Status eq 'IN_PROGRESS' or Status eq 'EXECUTED'

Regards,

Bharanidharan S P M

entry.title: Re: How to Track ETC and Plan Changes for Audit Trail in...
entry.content:
Good day @SVops 

Thank you for your question. See my response to each question below.

  1.   Is there a standard way to view change history for ETC and Plan values in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition?

Yes, in public cloud a standard audit trail for Customer Projects is available through Display Change Documents (also known as Show Change Documents).  

For your Customer Projects you can use these change documents, which is also the key for ETC and plan related audit:

  • Change Document for Commercial Project Header
  • Change Document for Commercial Project Financial Plans.
  • Chang Document for Commercial Project Roles and staffing.

See KBA 2913110 and Displaying Changes in Objects in Customer and Internal Project Management for more details.

  1. Can we access this information through Released CDS views?

There is no released CDS like I_ChangeDocument and I am not aware of any released CDS you can use for this in public cloud. See KBA 3337092 for more insights.

So, for audit evidence, i suggest you use the Display Change Documents app export and not CDS

Should you auditors require more details, you can use Display Security Audit Log. This is more complementary; it does not replace change documents.

 

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: SAP Cloud Connector Adding subaccount -Proxy cannot b...
entry.content:
Hi

The easiest is to use the authentication data that you can download from "connectivity/cloud connector". On top of the page, there is a blue button "Download authentication data". Then, on the SAP CC side, click "+ add subaccount" and choose the second option: "Configure using authentication data".

Select "Add subaccount authentication data from file" then select the downloaded file using the browse button.

 

That's it !

I just did it a few minutes ago with a trial account, and it works as expected.

Julien / Codilog

entry.title: SAP Community Voice: SAP Joule for Developers, Hobbies Series and Upcoming Events!
entry.content:
We‚Äôre happy to bring you another edition filled with highlights, stories, and updates from across our global SAP Community.

There is so much happening right now: from innovative blog posts and hands-on technical content to inspiring personal stories and exciting upcoming events around the world!

In this edition, we explore practical resources to support your SAP BW to SAP Datasphere journey, dive into AI-enabled development with ABAP and Joule, discover a beautiful story from our Hobbies Series, and of course, share important community news and events you won‚Äôt want to miss.

Let‚Äôs dive in! 

Featured Blog Posts 

Support with functionalities from SAP BW system to SAP Datasphere 

With the end of SAP BW approaching, many companies and developers are diving into SAP Datasphere to migrate reports and build new solutions. In this blog post, based on hands-on implementation experience, SAP member Christian Gravesen, focuses on one specific gap: the absence of standard BW exit variables like Current Month and Current Year in Datasphere. He presents a ready-to-install package that recreates these calendar variables, complete with GitHub access and clear installation guidance. This is a practical resource for anyone working on BW migrations or developing analytical models in SAP Datasphere. 

Read Christian Gravesen blog post here 

AI Enabled Application with ABAP AI SDK powered by ISLM 

As AI becomes a core part of application development, SAP Joule for Developers introduces AI-driven capabilities directly into the ABAP world. In this blog post, SAP¬¥s  Swathy explains how to move beyond traditional transactional scenarios by using the ABAP AI SDK powered by Intelligent Scenario Lifecycle Management (ISLM) to build AI-enabled applications. Through her example (generating a travel itinerary and budget breakdown using generative AI), she walks through the supported products, architecture, and key implementation steps. The ABAP AI SDK powered by ISLM is available in SAP BTP ABAP; SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and Cloud Private Edition. Additionally, if you want to keep updated about ABAP AI, there is a list of blog posts thread that you can subscribe to. 

Read Swathy blog post here 

SAP Joule Skill in SAP EHSM- Incident Management and more 

Since the beginning of this year, SAP community member Pardhasaradhi started posting great content about his SAP Joule learning and execution journey. One of his recent blog posts about SAP Joule Skill in SAP EHSM-Incident Management, he gives details about low-code and even no-code setup using OData Service. From understanding Joule capability types to configuring, deploying, and testing a custom skill, the blog provides a clear, practical guide for enabling conversational, AI-driven incident reporting in an enterprise environment. And because he is a highly active member on blogging, we highly recommend following his latest posts to keep learning about SAP Joule Skills in Asset Management Space and more! 

Read Pardhasaradhi Reddy Chelikam blog post here 

Automated Predictive Library (APL) Forecast in a Seamless Planning Model 

SAP¬¥s Max Gander and Marc Daniau recently published a very complete guide on how predictive forecasts built with SAP HANA‚Äôs Automated Predictive Library (APL) can be integrated into a seamless planning model. They explained that now with‚ÄØSAP Business Data Cloud‚ÄØand seamless planning,‚ÄØdata scientists‚ÄØcan now‚ÄØleverage‚ÄØHANA‚Äôs‚ÄØPredictive‚ÄØAnalysis Library (PAL) and Automated Predictive Library (APL)‚ÄØdirectly on the‚ÄØHANA‚ÄØdatabase of SAP Datasphere and nicely integrate the results into planning processes.‚ÄØIn the step-by-step guide, it is possible to visualize the full architecture, from building the forecast directly in HANA, orchestrating it via task chains in SAP Datasphere, and finally consuming the results as a live version in SAP Analytics Cloud. In the end, they recommend more useful content published in SAP Community. This is a definitely must-read. 

Read Max Gander and Marc Daniau blog post here 

Community News 

Don¬¥t forget, we are still waiting for your feedback!  

In the last Community Voice edition, we explained details about our 2026 SAP Community open survey. For more details, please check‚ÄØMynyna¬¥s‚ÄØBlog Post here, but we would like to remind everyone that there is still time to participate and give your opinion. The survey takes just a few minutes of your time and can be completed from your smartphone or computer.‚ÄØOnce the survey concludes, we will carefully analyze the results and share a report summary with you.‚ÄØ‚ÄØIf you‚ÄØshare the survey link / QR-Code in‚ÄØyour‚ÄØsocial media and comment‚ÄØon the blog post‚ÄØwith a link to your post that shows how you helped spread the word, you are automatically participating into a draw to win a‚ÄØvirtual‚ÄØmeet & greet with Josh Bentley, head of SAP Community! 

Click here to participate on the survey  

Hobbies Series:‚ÄØTerrace Gardening  

SAP‚Äôs Sumaiya recently shared her journey into gardening in the SAP Community Hobbies Series. A hobby that began simply and grew into a thriving terrace garden with over 300 plants, including fruits, vegetables, succulents, and ornamental species. She describes how gardening became a way to slow down, reconnect, and find balance beyond screens and schedules. Through her story, Sumaiya reflects on the lessons gardening has taught her, from patience and consistency to embracing challenges like weeds and pests with natural, sustainable solutions. In the end, she concludes with a parallel between gardening and the SAP world, highlighting how gardening reminds us that real success comes from nurturing systems patiently, not forcing outcomes, which helps her show up at work more grounded, focused, and calm. Besides the beautiful pictures she shared of her flowers, we were more than delighted to learn how this hobby has had such an impact on her life. 

Read Sumaiya blog post here 

Events 

Upcoming SAP CodeJam¬¥s  

This year events have officially started, and one of the greatest opportunities to have a hands-on learning experience is definitely through an SAP CodeJam. Around the world, our Developers team gives their best to bring their expertise and share useful tips on various SAP topics. Check bellow the list of the upcoming SAP CodeJam for the next 2 weeks:  

  • Milan, Italy - Joule Studio: Create Joule Skills and Agents ... - SAP Community 
  • Sydney, Austrakua -  Joule Studio: Create Skills and Agents to Ext... - SAP Community 
  • Pune, India - Getting started with Generative AI Hub on SAP... - SAP Community 
  • Heidelberg. Germany - SAP Build: Create Event-Based Processes (Heid... - SAP Community 
  • Pune, India - Build AI services using the CAP and Generativ... - SAP Community 
  • Paris, France - Joule Studio: Create Joule Skills and Agents ... - SAP Community 
  • Melbourne, Australia - Joule Studio: Create Skills and Agents to Exte... - SAP Community 
  • Brisbane, Australia - Gen AI Hub & Joule Studio : Create Skills and... - SAP Community 
  • Paris, France - Real-time data for AI agents: Grounding with ... - SAP Community 

SAP Inside Track Joinville 2026 

Are you part of the Joinville community group? Or maybe you live nearby? One of the biggest events of the year is coming up: SAP Inside Track Joinville 2026! You can expect high-level sessions on innovation, technology, and SAP trends, opportunities to exchange experiences with other community experts, and qualified networking with companies and professionals from the region. The event will take place on March 14 at √Ågora Tech Park, Joinville. Make sure to secure your spot and get your tickets through sympla. And follow the Joinville Group to have access to all the updates and news! 

Read more details in Juliane Schmitzhaus blog post here

entry.title: PPDS: Programmatic conversion of Planned Order to Production Order-ORDER_NOT_FOUND outside standard
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I am working on SAP APO / PPDS and trying to programmatically convert a PPDS planned order to a production order.

In the standard transaction (e.g. /SAPAPO/RPP7), the conversion works correctly. However, when I try to trigger the same logic from a custom ABAP program, I consistently receive the exception ORDER_NOT_FOUND.

I am currently calling the following function module
/SAPAPO/RRP_ORDER_SET_CNVIN

Observations
The same order exists and converts successfully when executed via the standard PPDS transaction.
The FM throws ORDER_NOT_FOUND when called from:
SE37
A custom Z-report
Some function modules mentioned online (e.g. order read helper FMs) do not exist in our APO release, suggesting a class-based PPDS runtime.
Understanding so far
It seems that standard PPDS transactions implicitly:

Initialize the planning context (planning version, session, liveCache)
Load the order into the PPDS buffer
Work with the internal PPDS ORDERID (GUID) rather than an external/display order number
Whereas in a custom program, this context is not initialized automatically, leading to ORDER_NOT_FOUND.

Questions
What is the SAP-recommended API (FM or class) to:
Retrieve the internal PPDS ORDERID
Convert a planned order to a production order programmatically?
What is the minimum required planning context initialization needed before calling the conversion logic?
Is there a released and supported approach for background/mass conversion outside the PPDS UI?
Any guidance, sample code, or SAP Notes would be highly appreciated.

Thanks in advance.

entry.title: Looking to extend the Capacity Planning applications?
entry.content:
The Fiori apps like Capacity Scheduling Table, and Capacity Scheduling Board support UI-level extensibility, that will allow key users and functional experts to add custom fields and filters using key user extensibility features without writing custom code or requiring in-depth technical knowledge, I will introduce the possible changes by using application:

- Custom Fields

- Manage Characteristic as Custom Fields 

Before starting, lets introduce the Business Context available for each application:

1. On Capacity Scheduling Board: You can easily adjust the Order Details displayed and the Operation Info once adjusting elements of UI Technology using Business context: Master Data: Product General and Master Data: Product Plant to add fields

After adjustments you can follow the following Navigation Path to select your new Custom Fields

  • Capacity Scheduling Board app > Select an order operation > Order Details
  • Capacity Scheduling Board app > Select an order operation > Operation Info

2. On  Capacity Scheduling Table: Extensibilities are allowed to adapt New Fields to be selected on Filters criteria and change the Layout of the worklist displayed by adding new additional information customized using business context: Master Data: Product General, Master Data: Product Plant, Order Master Data, Manufacturing: Planned Order Header and Production Orders: Variant Configuration

After adjustments you can follow the following Navigation Path to select your new custom Fields:

  • Capacity Scheduling Table app > Worklist Search filters > Adapt Filters // Flexible Column Layout > Additional Information
  • Capacity Scheduling Table app > Orders Table > Settings // Flexible Column Layout > Additional Information

-----

As part of this blog, I would like to share a Usage case where a customer wanted to personalize the Capacity Planning table to add new custom object for Characteristics used in Variant configuration to segregate the orders/operation displayed and prioritize some fo then to take leveling action in the right time.

------

The CPS application brings integration for business where Advanced Variant Configuration is in place, by allowing the Navigation to the Variant Configuration Screen to view the product configuration for the production orders (indicated by an icon).

In terms of extensibility, the Capacity Scheduling Table app is allowed to add characteristics since release OP2022 and in Cloud Editions, where planners can utilize characteristics from VC specific information to segregate the orders/operation listed and use characteristics as part of the filter criteria.

To achieve this is needed you use ‚ÄòManage Characteristics as Custom Fields‚Äô App

IMPORTANT NOTE :

As per SAP Note: 3220904 characteristic-based Field Extensibility (CFE) solution is redesigned, new business context is introduced (PRODUCTION_ORDER_CFE), where data load logic for characteristic-based custom fields has been optimized, and characteristic master data synchronization has been improved. Old business context (PP_ORD_CONFIGURATION_CFE) is marked as obsolete and should not be considered. BTW, This business Context is applicable as well to enhance Manage Production Orders

Now, after selecting Production Orders ‚Äì Variant Configuration: PRODUCTION_ORDER_CFE (AFPO) will display the details of the Business Context, where you can click on Edit, which will be allow changes in Draft mode to enable the addition and select de desired characteristic, as example we will select ‚ÄòLOBM_APO_SL_MIN‚Äô, add a Custom Field description ‚ÄòMin Shelf Life‚Äô and click on Save

After saving, the characteristic will be added to the custom Fields list, wait for some time to allow the system to publish, if needed you could use Refresh status for updates, and shortly the Characteristic change to Status ‚Äúready to use‚Äù, and at the same time checking back on the initial screen, all the business context were displayed, you should now see the new Consolidate status marked as ready to used

Now, to make ACV characteristic custom fields visible and usable in Capacity Scheduling Table app it is also required to extend source by opening Fiori app ‚ÄòCustom Field‚Äô app, and into the ‚ÄúData Source Extensions‚Äù and click on the plus button ‚Äò+‚Äù to add an extension of data source

A new pop-up window named New Data Source Extension will appear to insert, here you will add Data Source: PP_SCHEDULEPRODUCTION_SRV; Description: ZPP_SCHEDULEPRODUCTION_SRV (or desired), and Extension ID: ZPP_SCHEDULEPRODUCTI, the correlative will be automatically predefined and gray out. Once all is maintained you can select Create

This automatically will open a new Field Section to maintain the available field. Here you can extend the Field Path of Worklist Scheduling Products under Available Field Section, and select the characteristic added in the previous step, then click Save it and Publish.

Be aware that I have created previously another custom characteristic to refer to the Max Shelf Life in my scenario.

Now after refreshing the screen, you will see on the Data Source Extension List the Extension published

Finally, you are now able can navigate to Capacity Scheduling app and adapt the filters or modify the layout by modifying the view setting as needed!!!

Hope you find the example relevant to facilitate some of the custom requests on the application!!

Regards,

Jennifer!!

entry.title: Re: TIMEOUT dump (11 min.) for RFC in low priority (runti...
entry.content: As mentioned by Sandra Rossi, it might not be clear how the session priority is determined. Please, check the SAP Note 2129291 - Session Priority and Work Process Quota in SAP Kernels >= 7.4x for details. Especially, it mentions that the priority inheritance concept takes place ('As background jobs run with low priority, any RFC sessions created as a result of background jobs making RFC calls will be created with low priority as well.'), should you need to run your RFC as low prio, start the main program as a background job.

entry.title: SAP AI Skills Gap Analysis: Are We Ready?
entry.content:
The SAP AI Skills Assessment results are out, and there's a fascinating exploration of the gaps and readiness across the globe. Since the initial publication, the dataset has grown from 68 to 141 responses spanning 10 countries. The study revalidates the 1.6-2.1 point gap between motivation and implementation across different geographies, identifying systemic challenges rather than measurement artifacts.

Key findings illustrate a persistent implementation challenge, an awareness trap, a governance thread, and a pronounced focus on S/4HANA. Though awareness and motivation are relatively high, actual implementation capabilities significantly lag behind, with only 6-17% of professionals globally ready to implement AI solutions.

The report suggests shifting the focus from awareness campaigns to hands-on enablement strategies to bridge this significant gap. To harness the high motivation levels, it recommends a detailed training and role-based learning path, along with practical implementation experiences. Visit the provided blog from Thomas Jenewein for an in-depth analysis and to view the complete results.

I am interested in hearing your thoughts on how organizations can effectively bridge the gap between high motivation for AI implementation and the actual skills required, ensuring that the enthusiasm for AI translates into real-world, impactful applications.  Please comment below.

entry.title: Technical AS-IS EA Canvas: Accelerating Assessments in Undocumented Environments
entry.content:
Introduction: The AS-IS Challenge in Clients Without Documentation

In Enterprise Architecture (EA) projects, the very first and most critical step is establishing an accurate AS-IS baseline. However, in many companies, formal documentation simply does not exist. Knowledge about applications, integrations, and infrastructure often lives only in the minds of employees.

In environments like this, trying to capture requirements directly into tools such as SAP LeanIX‚Äîor relying on long email threads‚Äîbecomes slow, inefficient, and error‚Äëprone.

To address this challenge and accelerate the Assessment phase, we developed and successfully applied the Technical AS-IS EA Canvas methodology.
You can access the methodology assets here:
üëâ link

The Solution: A Cognitive & Tactile Methodology Supported by AI

Our approach innovates by separating human interaction from metadata capture, using AI to produce high-fidelity insights from the workshop.

1. The Tactile and Visual Workshop (The Canvas)

The heart of the methodology is the Technical AS-IS EA Canvas, a large-format (A0/A1) printed board designed for collaborative mapping.

Key characteristics:

  • Structure: The Canvas visually separates the technology landscape into On-Premise, Cloud, and External, aligned with the TOGAF ADM phases.
  • Interaction: Participants use colored post-its (following ArchiMate patterns for Application, Technology, and Business) to map systems, while strings represent integration flows.
  • Capabilities: Tools like SAP Signavio Process Explorer are used during the session to anchor discussions and ensure the mapping reflects true business capabilities.

2. High-Fidelity Data Capture (Audio + AI)

The major differentiator of this methodology is how the technical metadata is captured:

  • Recording & Cognition: Instead of taking notes, the architect focuses on facilitating the session using a guided Cheat-Sheet. The entire session is recorded.
  • AI Synthesis: The audio is then processed by an AI engine that extracts the essential metadata:
    • protocols
    • integration frequency
    • triggers
    • pain points
    • non-functional requirements
    • security considerations
    • and other technical details often lost in traditional workshops

This ensures no insight is missed.

3. The Result: Structured Data Ready for SAP LeanIX

The combination of photo + audio + AI extraction produces a reliable and complete dataset.

  • Structured Output: AI produces clean, structured metadata from the discussion.
  • Direct Import: This dataset is formatted and imported into SAP LeanIX, feeding the EA repository with a high-confidence AS-IS.
  • Focus on To-Be: With the AS-IS complete, architects can move directly to Gap Analysis and To-Be Architecture, drastically accelerating the project lifecycle.

Conclusion

The Technical AS-IS EA Canvas methodology demonstrates how tactile, visual engagement combined with AI capabilities solves one of the biggest challenges in Enterprise Architecture: capturing knowledge in undocumented environments.

We were able to extract all relevant requirements, applications, and integration flows‚Äîbuilding a robust EA baseline in SAP LeanIX with confidence and speed.

This approach not only reduces risk but transforms the AS-IS assessment into an engaging, high-value experience for all participants.

What about you?

I would love to hear your experiences with AS-IS capture in undocumented environments.
How do you deal with missing documentation in EA projects?

Share your thoughts and let‚Äôs exchange best practices!

Transparency Note: This post was drafted with the assistance of an Artificial Intelligence model to ensure clarity and structure.

entry.title: Re: SAP PM Tables Word Puzzle
entry.content:
QMEL-Notification Header Table

ILOA-  PM Location and Account Assignment 

EQKT-Equipment Short Texts

EQUI ‚Äì Equipment Master (General Data)
IFLOT ‚Äì Functional Location
AUFK ‚Äì Order Master
AFKO ‚Äì Order Header Data (PP/PM Orders)
AFPO ‚Äì Order Item
AFVC ‚Äì Operations
CRHD ‚Äì Work Center Header
MPOS ‚Äì Maintenance Plan Items
MPLA ‚Äì Maintenance Plan Header

entry.title: BKP: AI-Assisted Input Assistance in the ‚ÄúManage Customer Returns‚ÄìVersion 2‚Äù App
entry.content:
Intro

Creating customer returns efficiently is a critical part of modern sales operations. With SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2602, we introduce AI-assisted input recommendations in the SAP Fiori app ‚ÄúManage Customer Returns ‚Äì Version 2‚Äù, designed to make returns order creation faster, more accurate, and more user-friendly. This article walks you through the business context, capabilities, and practical usage of this intelligent input assistance, helping you understand how it supports everyday work in customer returns management.

 

What You‚Äôll Learn

After reading this article, you will understand:

  • The business context behind AI-assisted input recommendations
  • How input assistance works during returns order creation
  • Prerequisites, and tips for successful usage

Business Context: Why Input Assistance Matters

The customer returns solution (Scope Item BKP) allows end users to create returns orders using the Manage Customer Returns ‚Äì Version 2 app. In real-life scenarios, users often face challenges such as:

  • New users may not yet be familiar with the app and need guidance to create returns orders effectively.
  • Users may be uncertain about the accuracy of certain values, such as the returns process variant.
  • Some users prefer to default specific values, such as logistical follow-up activities, based on the order or return reason.

To address these needs, we provide input assistance through an AI innovation called ‚ÄúAI-assisted input recommendations for returns order creation‚Äù .

 

AI-Assisted Input Recommendations: Overview and Benefits

The AI-assisted input recommendations are available in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and work directly within the Manage Customer Returns ‚Äì Version 2 app.

Key Benefits

  • Increased Process Efficiency
    Data entry time is reduced as users can rely on AI-driven suggestions based on historical data.
  • Enhanced Data Accuracy
    The system recommends precise values for fields where users may be unsure, reducing errors.

Core Capabilities

  • Recommendations are shown in real time during returns order creation.
  • Suggestions are based on patterns learned from past returns orders with the same process variants.
  • The AI solution supports easy onboarding with Turnkey AI, provided conditions are met.
  • Input recommendations are automatically available.
  • Recommended values are ranked, and those with a prediction probability above 70% are highlighted.

Input and Output Fields Supported by AI

The AI-assisted input recommendations cover both document header and document item levels. The following shows the user input and related output fields:

How AI Input Assistance Works

Returns Order Header Creation

  1. Start by entering the document type and sales area.
  2. Once you enter the sold-to party, the system begins recommending values for the order reason.
  3. If a value has a prediction probability above 70%, it is highlighted (for example, Standard Return (009)).
  4. When opening the value list, the top recommended values are displayed.
  5. You must accept a highlighted value or choose a different one. If no confirmation is made, the system will prompt you during saving. 

Returns Order Item Creation

  1. Enter the product first. This triggers recommendations for additional fields, such as return reason and logistical follow-up activity.
  2. Recommended values appear in the value list. If none exceed the 70% probability threshold, no value is highlighted.
  3. When a value (for example, Receive into Plant) exceeds the threshold, it is highlighted.
  4. As you accept or enter more fields (such as return reason), the system continues recommending values for subsequent fields. For example, a refund code may be highlighted with a prediction probability of 100%.
  5. If you change a value such as the logistical follow-up activity, related fields may also be recommended. For instance, selecting Ship to Supplier (0005) may trigger a recommendation for the supplier number. 

     

  6. If you do not accept a highlighted recommendation, the system will display a confirmation pop-up later.
  7. Once all necessary fields are accepted, you can successfully save the returns order.

    Prerequisites and Important Tips

    To use AI-assisted input recommendations, the customer returns recommendation machine learning model must be trained, deployed, and activated.

    Training Options

    We provide two approaches:

    1. Auto Training (Turnkey AI)

    Turnkey AI is automatically activated if all the following conditions are met:

    • A Data Attribute Recommendation (DAR) connection is established
    • Minimum data volume requirements are fulfilled:
      • 3,000 eligible items for production systems
      • 1,000 eligible items for quality or test systems

    2. Manual Training

    For detailed steps on manual training or on how to cancel input recommendations, refer to the SAP online help portal:
    AI-Assisted Input Recommendations for Returns Order Creation | SAP Help Portal

    Summary

    AI-assisted input recommendations in Manage Customer Returns ‚Äì Version 2 app are designed to reduce effort, improve accuracy, and guide both new and experienced users through returns order creation. By learning from historical data and providing real-time suggestions, it helps ensure smoother processes and more confident decision-making in customer returns management.

    As customer return solutions continue to evolve its AI capabilities, features like this represent a practical step toward more intelligent, user-friendly enterprise applications.

entry.title: Re: LGM Knowledge Snippet: How do we determine carriers (as of now...)
entry.content:
Hello @beata_d,

I would like to comment on your question about the carrier propagation in the TU-based TM-EWM integration and Adv. SR. In both scenarios, the carrier defined in the freight order will be propagated to the EWM ODO.

TU-Based TM-EWM Integration

  • FU is assigned to a freight order and freight order is set to 'Load Plan Status (Stop) = Finalized'
  • => Freight order carrier is propagated to the EWM ODO (cf. 'Partner' tab)

Adv. SR (Transport-Driven Scenario)

  • FU is assigned to a freight order and freight order is set to 'Ready for Warehouse Processing'
  • => Freight order carrier is propagated to the EWM ODO

BR, Mathias

entry.content:
We would like to implement functionality to automatically post MIRO (Invoice Verification) entries based on corresponding MIGO (Goods Receipt) entries, ensuring seamless linkage between goods receipt and invoice processing. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

entry.title: Re: Automate MIRO process
entry.content:
Could you please consider using Evaluated Receipt Settlement (ERS) which can post invoice documents for the open goods receipt automatically? 

Please refer to following online documentation for detailed information about the ERS procedure and how to use it:
https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/0e602d466b99490187fcbb30d1dc897c/1771b6531de6b64ce10000000a174cb4.html?locale=en-US&state=PRODUCTION&version=LATEST
